name: JSON Creator Processor
description: Creates a JSON element and allows to insert evaluated Tuktu strings.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The JSON element, can contain Tuktu Strings (in JsStrings). Usually a JsObject. If you want to insert a JsObject using Tuktu Strings, use a JsString like so: "$JSON.parse{${object}}", or if you want to convert a Map to a JsObject on the fly: "$JSON.parse{$JSON.stringify{map}}". Works not only on top-level, but also as a value within an object, and not only on maps, for example: { "${key}": "$JSON.parse{$JSON.stringify{number}}"} (remember that keys never need to and hence can not be parsed as JSON, since they need to be strings)
